summary: This document is an email chain between FBI/DOJ personnel discussing an unsolicited email from a civilian named Jose Leon. Leon claims to have video footage of extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The internal emails suggest the sender is considered unreliable, and the standard practice is to forward such unverified information to a specific team.

persons.name: Jose Leon
persons.context: Sent an unsolicited email to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York claiming to have video footage of extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.context: Mentioned by Jose Leon as being connected to alleged extremists/traffickers and video footage in Wisconsin.

connections.description: Both are named together by Jose Leon in connection to alleged trafficking activity in Wisconsin.
Leon is making an unsolicited claim of having evidence (video footage) connected to Epstein.
Leon is making an unsolicited claim of having evidence (video footage) connected to Maxwell.

events.title: Civilian email submission to US Attorney's Office
events.description: Jose Leon sends an email to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York claiming to have video footage of extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A civilian named Jose Leon contacted the US Attorney's Office with claims of video footage showing extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
Internal FBI/DOJ emails characterize the sender as 'a little off' and suggest the information is unverified.
The standard practice for such unverified civilian information is to forward it to a specific team within the FBI/DOJ.
The email includes links to Google Photos albums, though the specific content is not described in the text.
